website_summaries.verdict: Many riders will appreciate the convenience of a folding bicycle for short commutes and camping trips. We suggest getting a professional tune-up and possibly changing out the seat before hitting the road for the first time.
pros: Fits most car trunks and closets when folded
cons: Smaller wheels and gear cassette make pedaling a challenge
Relatively heavy, hard to carry for distances

website_summaries.verdict: The Loop's smaller tire size make it challenging as a cruiser bike, but it is ideal as a commuter. The frame is sturdy enough for heavier adult riders as well. Worthy of the Schwinn name and reputation.
pros: Gears and brakes work very smoothly
Will support an electric bike motor
cons: Professional adjustment required for warranty protection
Original gear configuration may be too low
Frame is heavier than expected and challenging to fold

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, just took out of the box unfolded connected ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, just took out of the box unfolded connected one of the paddle and it is ready for a ride. I am very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: CARECA

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike! So easy to fold and unfold. It's a bit heavy for me to load to my SUV, but it's ok. I consider that a work out. I give this four stars because the seat is a little hard. I recommend ordering that seat that people are talking about. I will be buying more of these folding bikes in the future. Too bad they don't come in yellow (my favorite color) :)
customer_reviews.author: LardyLardSOS

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if states used but good.  Its was probably not tested.
customer_reviews.text: I had a clicking problem when first purchased. Two months later I was riding behind my wife and noticed the ring holding bottom bracket and cranks just call off , luckily I saw this and yelled for her to stop which scared her to death. The cranks just slid to one side which would have caused a really bad crash of I had not seen this. Had to have fixed but now clicking sound is back.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small commutes
customer_reviews.text: I live in Brooklyn NY and this bike is so nice riding to work early in the mornings. I can fold it in the corner of the clinic I work at, and on the bus. The only thing I’d suggest is change the seat out because the one it comes with is hard, and also a Velcro strap to hold the bike together while it’s folded. It’s slightly awkward to carry, but it gets the job done! Tops I ride it 4-6 miles a day, and it’s been great so far!
customer_reviews.author: tal

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a commuter bike, dont want to go up hills
customer_reviews.text: PROS: simple, strong and sturdy, smooth ride, useful, compact as stated CONS: not small and light as I expected (but I assume if it were any lighter and smaller, it might as well been a cheap clown bike), butt hurts because of the seat..i swear they attached a poor quality seat on purpose therefore BUY A SEAT WITH YOUR PURCHASE, OR YOU'LL JUST END UP BUYING ONE LATER. CONCLUSION: no point in trying to save money and not buying a replaceable bike seat, so I highly recommend buying one. Great bike, and I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: syooo

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike
customer_reviews.text: Felt like I took a gamble on buying this bike because the reviews genuinely concerned me, but I got lucky. The bike came really well made. Didn't need much assembly. Just needed to unfold, tighten the breaks and bike seat, and I was good to go. Rides very smoothly. The only major complaint that I have about this bike is the seat. I should've heeded other peoples' warnings because riding 6.2 miles in one go left my behind out of commission for a week. Please buy a well cushioned bike seat. It'll save you. Will edit this review if I run into any issues in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: Don’t!!! Save for real folding bike
customer_reviews.text: I had it put together at a bike shop ($70) The derailleur broke in second ride. The brakes are so soft they needed daily tightening, and the brake handles are floppy & plastic-y. Then the main hinge securing bolt just fell off yesterday, two weeks outside of return date. Heavy & very difficult to fold (and I’m a 180 pd guy) Save up for a $500+ folder, or just walk! Safer and cheaper. Schwinn, before selling their name, made heavy strong bikes. This one is just heavy.
customer_reviews.author: wonderful

customer_reviews.title: Rear Gear Cassette Wobbles When The Wheel Spins
customer_reviews.text: I'll just keep this short. The whole gear cassette on the rear wheel wobbles while the rear wheel spins to the point that the chain won't fully engage on any gear.. Likely some issue with either the axle bearing race or perhaps it's the axle itself. I had high hopes for this little bike, but ended up VERY DISAPPOINTED. Clearly, QC on the bike I received failed. I'm returning it and will not order another.
customer_reviews.author: Razzierb

customer_reviews.title: TL:DR Just go to ur local bike shop. Or Walmart.
customer_reviews.text: may be a little biased because my bike came not even fully assembled. The handle bars were crooked and jiggly. The back wheel arrived popped (not flat, popped) and the chains lock up. I have to oil everyday for the chains to not make so much noise. A dropped a good amount on this bike which wasn’t easy but I’ve never bought myself a new bike so I decided to treat myself. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Rachell Masferrer

customer_reviews.title: No assembly required with my bike
customer_reviews.text: I had to fight UPS to get it but that was expected. This bike - winner. Schwinn's design is sleek and sturdy all around. It's heavier than expected, but I might just be weaker than expected. I realize the folding quality is a selling point, but it's not a compact and I'd hoped. The next model might want to work on folding handle bars instead of the post. The brake lines get caught if you're not careful folding and unfolding the bike. I don't see myself using the folding mechanism much. It looks greats and doesn't take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Eyob Moges

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little tank of a bicycle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 9-11-2014. Time for an update. January 2018. When I first purchased this little bike...I thought it was a little pricey. I bought it to traverse through and to and from two one million square foot convention centers and the parking lots. I ride it daily at work. I've worn out two rear tires and one front tire. It's even survived one collision with a golf cart. It still shifts and operates just fine. I've only had two failures on this bike.... The front sprocket chain guard and the riders' right folding pedal. Amazing little tank of a bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: McGowan, Tammy

customer_reviews.title: a great little bike
customer_reviews.text: I got one for xmas. Overall, a great little bike. I did upgrade the seat as recommended and upgraded the derailleurs as well. The bike mechanic pointed out the stock part is a $10 item and the $20 upgrade is a much better bet with less slipping. the stock ones were fine on the flat, but slipped going up hills. I also added some no-flat inserts for $15 as I hate changing flats.
customer_reviews.author: 1runr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Campground or Neighborhood Bicycle
customer_reviews.text: This Loop bicycle is great for around the campground or neighborhood. Anyone can mount and ride it easily, because of its low stance, whether child or adult. The seat post is adjustable, but very thick...not standard. Some accessories, such as the rear light (separate purchase), may need longer bolts to secure it to the clamp. Read the instructions for assembly. Once you go through it, it becomes easy to fold, etc. The Loop is lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk..
customer_reviews.text: The seventh gear wore down after six months and now after two months the sixth gear wore down..the bike is of no use to me now..what a piece of junk..
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for taking on the road !
customer_reviews.text: This Schwinn bake is exactly what I was looking for. Arrived quickly and completely assembled ! Such a classy bike very sturdy and all parts working properly. I am a 68 year old woman and can easily fold up the bike and stow in our jeep for traveling. Rides like a dream ( May purchase a cushier seat ) and able to adjust seat and handle bars to your liking and comfort. Best of all comes with lifetime guarantee. Good to know Schwinn stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: RVHOBO

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike and fun to ride
customer_reviews.text: I first heard of folding bikes from a friend. As a grandma, I decided it would be fun to have something to ride near home and also would be easy to put in the car and take along to ride with grandchildren. It is so fun to ride a bike again. It is sturdy and the tires handle my unpaved country roads well. There was a bit of a learning curve to folding it up; it does get easier each time. I can lift it myself to put into the car. It is everything I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: ReaderIsland

customer_reviews.title: Got a flat a week after we bought it and it was an easy fix as well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bike for my 6 foot 3, 300lb husband. He rides it to work daily (4 miles round trip) and he really likes it. The brakes were a little off when he first rode it and he had to adjust them. Got a flat a week after we bought it and it was an easy fix as well. Sleek looking, folds and unfolds easily, tight fit in the bag it comes with but all in all a great foldable bike.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike
customer_reviews.text: FABULOUS bike. Comfy. Easy to ride. Easy to fold and unfold. I feel in control on THIS sized bike (vs. the larger old ones). Taking to our bike shop to get 'validated' so I can have the lifetime warrantee. Looking so forward to riding it to work. Got to get my sit bones used to the seat though. That will take a while, as I recall from the last time I was on a bike. So excited for my GIFT TO MYSELF.
customer_reviews.author: heather bowes

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this bike works as expected. It is a very smooth ride and has seven gears to help you pedal as comfortably as you want to. Folds up and takes up as much as a person would on a seat without taking up any room in front of it or the floor. It comes with its own carrying case but it's a huge pain to put in. It is easy to unfold and fold once you do it a few times. Fully assembled outside of the box. The only thing you need to do is pump air into the tires. Got this for my girlfriend and she likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Gena

customer_reviews.title: Even a short granny can ride this bike!
customer_reviews.text: I am 67 years old, 5'2" tall with short legs! This is the perfect bicycle for me! Rides smoothly and shifts very well! I don't feel like it is to much bicycle for me to handle like the cruisers did. I can control it very easily. Goes smoothly up hills and turns very well! The seat is pretty hard so ordered a larger comfort seat. Easy to assemble and fold ond unfold! Although the locks are tight right now, I am sure they will loosen up as I use the more. LOVE THIS BIKE!
customer_reviews.author: George W Smith

customer_reviews.title: The small wheels makeca lot of difference.
customer_reviews.text: I have fallen off twice not while riding but when I come to a stop it is like there isn't enough room to put your feet down the pedals are right. I figured it out - when you ride a regular bike you lean forward put on the breaks and then your feet come down in front of the pedals. The way the handle bars are you can't learn forward - also when you go around curves you can't lean into them with this bike. I have a Bianchi that I have ridden for years. Can't explain it, but this bike just feels weird, could just be me. Ride one before you buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Carr

customer_reviews.title: Had to balance, dangerous, rocky
customer_reviews.text: I have been a skillful bike rider for sixty years, but this little stinker is a dangerous challenge. I'm six feet tall and the low handlebars make it uncomfortable to ride. Worse, it is rocky and hard to balance. There is a danger of falling when starting, and a danger of falling when riding slowly among obstacles. Never have I had these problems with full-size bicycles. I am keeping it for occasional use and because the kind of bike I like best is no longer available (the good old 3-speed Raleigh and its cousins.)
customer_reviews.author: Ted Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great transportable bike, perfect for bar hopping.
customer_reviews.text: Do you want to uber, taxi, subway, etc with your bike? This is the one you want. Even comes with a carrying case. The 7 gears it has actually work very well. Brakes stop great. You cannot go up and down curbs as the handle bars are not welded into the frame due to it being foldable. They fold at a 45 degree angle and clip pretty well but not in such a way you would chance putting the majority of your weight on the handle bars. Stay seated. This is the only downside I feel but not worth knocking it down a star.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: OK folding bike
customer_reviews.text: For the price its a ok folding bike. Its on the heavy side. I found it hard to fold. (this might just be a user issue). I liked that it came with fenders and rack. I swapped out the seat for ones others recommend. I believe it was a cloud 9 seat. I didn't like the handle bar.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for heavier riders as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bike specifically because online reviews say it’s a great choice for heavier riders. However when it arrived, the manual says the weight limit is 230lbs. That’s only 10lbs more than the average bike. This is very disappointing as I spent weeks researching the perfect bike for my heavy self. I really hope this bike holds my weight or it will be $350 in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: ana de la campa

customer_reviews.title: Love my  bime5
customer_reviews.text: I had this bike for two weeks I ride back and forth to work took the bike today 18 mile run Bike ran beautiful smooth gear change My only complaint would be handle bar does not go higher and I change the seat but I gave it 5 star because she a great folding bike smooth all around
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool Folding Bike!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one to be sure and it took just a few minutes to get it up and running! The gear changer needs an adjustment but for me no big deal. Ordered and second one. The two bikes fit neatly in our Subaru Outback. Geat on level and small hilly areas. Yes, the bag should be a bit bigger and more durable. We bought the best one it weighs in at about 30 lbs. so its easy to lift. The seat is awful -ordered a comfy one with flashing lights. Well made, great bike!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, made to last, 33 lbs.
customer_reviews.text: FAb. I am 63 with a horrible bad back, I can negotiate all fold, unfold and get it up into car trunk. It noplave says weight, 33 lbs! It is lovely and sturdy! I did buy the better seat and be forewarned, myself and two men couldn’t get the bolt loose to put it on bike , had to take to bike shop! They did it free, but I tipped them, so sweet! Just take the post to them.
customer_reviews.author: truth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'3" , this bike is my favorite fit, ever! I'm 70 now and most often just want to ride to park and trail and home again! So convenient too, easy folding and loading into car....no more having to take my bike off trunk rack and into motel when traveling! Solid built..added a horn and taillight...good to go. Comes padded and packed very well, Only needs pedal affixed.
customer_reviews.author: Syndrella

customer_reviews.title: Check the brakes!
customer_reviews.text: Bike came 97% assembled and was packed very well. It was very easy to unpack and fold to ready position. Just had to attach one pedal , tighten some bolts and your done. Bike was moderately heavy but felt sturdy. The only problem I had with the bike was the back brake. It wouldn’t adjust correctly and was rubbing against the rim. I took it to a bike shop and was told that the back brake spring was bent and needed to be changed. Unfortunately I was not happy and returned the bike.
customer_reviews.author: 93minpin

customer_reviews.title: It came well packed and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small fold up for a 4 mile ride it take every day. It came well packed and easy to set up. Gears had to be adjusted but no biggie, shifts like butter. I did change the seat though. Fold up is easy and the bag will fit you just have to make sure the no folding peddle is against the back tire or close to it. Throw the cover over the bike then turn it upside down (seat and rack on the ground) zip it and turn it upright. It fits standing in the trunk of my car. Rides good I enjoy this bike and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: mach54

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted in a bike.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty darn happy with this bike and feel the price I paid for it was terrific. I have a small car and do not want to use a bike rack yet want to be able to transport my bike to different sites and now I can! There was very minimal assembly to this and it was easy to do, the bike folds and unfolds easily and rides nice. The step through design is a very nice feature. I marked the depth for my seat on the seat stem itself with a marker to eliminate guesswork there when unfolding. I may replace the seat but am going to try a seat cover first.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed so we ordered two
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what we needed for camping, we down sized from many years of mountain biking trail riding because of inconvenient transportation with our camper set up, this meets every need for us and we love the product. A few downsides are getting used to the difference in riding from two inch wide tires to narrow "street " tires. One thing to make sure of for better steering is to insure the handle bar post is tightened to prevent "slop". The back rack is the most solid of any we have had, not an add on but a part of the bike frame.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bob

customer_reviews.title: Your buns will hate you
customer_reviews.text: Love the bike. Easy to fold. Fits in my trunk. The only gripe is the seat. It is extremely hard and uncomfortable. When I took it out for the first time, I hit a bump and broke my tailbone. No joke. Buy a comfortable seat and replace the factory seat.
customer_reviews.author: andrew dailey

customer_reviews.title: What I don't like is the plastic fenders and plastic chain guard
customer_reviews.text: I needed a inexpensive compact bike and this seemed to fit. What I don't like is the plastic fenders and plastic chain guard. The right-hand break grip is short and awkward to use. The gearing is not what I expected, you have to peddle faster than normal even in 1. It serves it's purpose so I will keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Mele

customer_reviews.title: Sorry Schwinn... just didn't work out.
customer_reviews.text: 1. It was way to heavy to carry for any extended period of time.... I am a 5'3 girl who could stand to workout more in general but sheesh! 2. The bike doesn't lock into place when it's folded up and thus I hit my self in the shin real hard trying to get it into the car 3. That seat was horrible! Rock solid and very invasive if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: C. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple sclerosis and have a difficult time getting on and off of a regular bicycle. This bicycle is so easy to get on to and easy to get off of with no problems. I love how it folds up and I can take it many places because I cannot walk for a long time. It helps me to keep up with some of the others that are walking with me peddling my bike slowly. It's great to take on vacations.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: The bike's nice! It's no high-performance bicycle but it does fold ...
customer_reviews.text: The bike's nice! It's no high-performance bicycle but it does fold easy. While riding I found it to be a little touchy on control and had to slow myself down several times to prevent injury. It comes with a bag but good luck folding it and getting it to fit within. My girlfriend has had no issues with hers but mine refuses to go above gear 5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Have had this bike not even 2 weeks. Main part of the bike in the middle will not fold. Rear brake is literally one thread away from completely snapping. Any bump you hit the handlebars feel like it’s gonna come apart. It says they give you a lifetime warranty. I guess that’s to make comfortable not knowing you’re buying a piece of junk
customer_reviews.author: DC Man

customer_reviews.title: Grandma
customer_reviews.text: A year later.. this bike is solid as a rock.. it would outlast your grandmother!!
customer_reviews.author: Itay S.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted. Love this bike!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike. It’s very sturdy and well made. The locking mechanisms lock tightly and are easy to use. Folds up neatly in a few minutes. I keep it in the back of my my Jeep at all times so I can use it all the time. Perfect for riding downtown and in recreation areas. I Bought a cruiser seat for it, although the seat that came with it was good quality. I just wanted something wider. Great value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: great bike.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered July 1... received at my door on July 3rd ( using Amazon PRIME) ... great bike... easy to unfold.. nice ride, good manual. YouTube Info available. Purchased to use on trips using a sub-compact car. More secure to store in my car than using an external bike carrier... and some Motels don't allow storing in your room. Only adjust was the rear brake cable... minor tweak. Rear carrier is rugged. No problem bagging... just position the peddles correctly. The seat seems OK to me, but my butt is firm after 30yrs of biking. I purchased for $204... notice that now ( July 6, the price is varying day to day from $246 to $319).... not sure why
customer_reviews.author: Fred Tarburton

customer_reviews.title: Get your exercise on
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because i didn't have a lot of space and needed something compact. It is easy to assemble, easy to fold but you have to be careful not to get your fingers in the way of the pinch points. Comes with its own bag but can be a little heavy. I didn't like the seat so I upgraded to an extra large one that is very comfortable. Now i enjoy riding for leisure. A great find.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Young

customer_reviews.title: Ist 24 hrs . Will revisit
customer_reviews.text: Setup easy . One bike perfect , other needed some adjustments-fenders offline . Brakes needed adjustments. Exactly what we wanted for a bit of riding around . Main use will be camping/traveling , goes nicely in camper . Glad to see/use sturdy kickstand . No problems with gears and alignment, unlike some pictures. Looking forward to using .
customer_reviews.author: Sharlie Kessler

customer_reviews.title: It's ok...
customer_reviews.text: It's not a high quality folding bike like a Dahon (don't be fooled, anyone who says it's better than a Dahon is not being truthful). You can't adjust the handle bars, the folding mechanism is flawed, you will need a bungy cord to keep it folded and it is a very slow bike. Lots of cheap parts. I does come fully assembled. Just don't plan on using it for more than a mile or two.
customer_reviews.author: Robert York

customer_reviews.title: Come fully assembled so don't pay extra for assembly. Easy fold and unfold with quick release
customer_reviews.text: We are going to use these for camping. Small space so these are perfect, sturdy quality. Easy fold and unfold with quick release. My husband is just over 200 lb. He likes the bike also. A little heavy but that is for a sturdy feeling bike. Quick shipping, one bike got lost in transit and customer service got another bike shipped out asap. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mtakachamvungu

customer_reviews.title: Break pads...
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike and all but the brake pads hit the tire no matter how many times I adjust it. Which made it a little hard to ride. Seems like they are uneven. One part of the pad rubs while other doesnt. Contacted Schwinn to see if that warranty would come in handy but they just kinda blew me off. So now I have to either pay to have it fixed or try to exchange it for another one. Also the reflector was poorly glued on. Was sitting in the bottom of the box when I opened it.
customer_reviews.author: GERSTY

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I've always been intrigued with a folding bike and finally made the leap and purchased this Schwinn Loop bike. I've had it for 2 months now and have been very happy with how easy it is to fold and unfold. It fits in the trunk of my Mustang and I can take it easily anywhere. I had to drop my car off to the dealer for service and I just took the bike out and unfolded it and pedaled off. I am 6'2" and fit this bike easily. I like the quality of the bike and anticipate a long service life.
customer_reviews.author: David Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike has a very unusual construction. I had a flat tire (rear) and it took me some time to disassemble the rear wheel. The problem with it is that the construction is very complicated and I was not able to reassemble it back. I spent 5 hours doing that, watching YouTube videos, trying to learn. Unless you want to take it to the bike shop every time you have a flat tire - avoid this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, try
customer_reviews.text: This is my second bike this year. The first was awful and I gave it to my husband to suffer, but this one is AMAZING!!! It's light, comfortable and easy to ride( I'm far from professional bike rider though). It doesn't take much space to store. I'm absolutely in love with this bike. So far this is the best bike I ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months everything it’s staring to brake
customer_reviews.text: Don’t even waste your money on this bike,it’s expensive and it keeps having issues with the brakes,adjustment with the folding part,stearin,seat and honestly I regret buying a heavy bike and I have to constantly spend money on fixing a worthless bike,I’m not a heavy person and I don’t Travel far from home 5 days a week,the seat it’s so hard that it makes it uncomfortable to ride I have one year exactly using this nightmare and I’m never Ever would recommend to anymore,it’s a waste of money be ware.
customer_reviews.author: Haxorous

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery, quick to setup, excellent value for price
customer_reviews.text: Installation guide mentions about tools but in reality just need a scissors to cut the taping. Everything was installed already, just needed to flip one of the folded pedals. Low center bar makes new learners feel safe to jump down easily. It took 20 mins in an empty parking lot for a young adult to learn how to bike on this. Packaging was done very well and delivery was white glove quality.
customer_reviews.author: Fatih Karakurt

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay folded
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a truck driver and wanted to be able to ride his bike during his rest time. He keeps his bike in his truck and it does not take up much space. It did not take long to put together and he likes the way it rides. His only complaint is that there is nothing to hold it in its folded position when it's standing up. It comes open unless you lay it down.
customer_reviews.author: solsister8

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for everyone
customer_reviews.text: this bike comes assembled except for pedals- it rides great ( as a senior citizen with 2 knee replacements) and my grandsons love to ride it when they come over- it folds with a click of the pin and stores in the easily in the back of my van- light weight- people stop me when I ride it and want to know where I got it-no regrets so far!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Spriensma

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bike
customer_reviews.text: Comes pretty much ready to go out of the box. Had to adjust/tighten one or two things on my own, but easy enough to do. We don't really collapse it much, so I'm not sure how that would be everyday. It's a bit small for larger people, but works great for my wife (about 5'7"). I can ride it too (5'11-6'), but prefer my larger bike. doesn't have a ton of gears, but has the most useful ones for 90% of the time (Lowest gear makes it ok for climbing hills, highest gear gets some pretty good speed).
customer_reviews.author: Force2BRW

customer_reviews.title: Easy on and off.
customer_reviews.text: I have been riding the bike daily for one week. I enjoy it. I bought this model because the “Loop” design is easy to mount and dismount. I have mobility issues. This bike works for me. Good brakes. Great derailleur. Nice paint. Not a heavy bike. The seat hurts my rear. I’m an older guy with injuries. I have ordered a CloudNine touring type seat. This bike gets me back on two wheels. I’m grateful for that. I’m glad I bought this bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: sheazo

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement but overall content
customer_reviews.text: I just took this baby out on the Galveston, TX seawall and let me tell you it was turning heads. The loop gives you a freer feeling and it rides smooth. I think this would get 5 stars if it was cheaper but for the price it gets 3 CONS: - not enough lower gears - kick stand is pretty useless, bike falls over - handle bar grips are thin - wheels too small - tires too thin - rusts quickly - stock seat is very uncomfortable - brakes and other parts damage when folded - handle bar is not adjustable
customer_reviews.author: sliknslim

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bike
customer_reviews.text: I love my bike. I love the design, the size, the hand brakes, the gears, the rear rack and the fact that we can fold it and take it anywhere we want. However, when folded, it is a little bulkier and heavier than other folding bikes (ie. Vilano Urbana, which in turn doesn't have hand brakes, multiple gears nor rear rack). I also bought a different seat for my Schwinn Loop. I have already taken it for quite a few rides and it has done very well.
customer_reviews.author: YR

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. It's a bit on the heavy side, but manageable, it's not a bike for the tour de France any way. The fact that it doesnt stay folded is a slight problem buy easily solved with a bungee cord. Don't know about the seat complaints because I changed it immediately. Its beautiful, sturdy and seems very durable. I just tightened it a bit, aire on tires and ready to go. I use it to drive around town and my girlfriend drives to college with it. Draws a lot of attention and everybody wants to hope on it. Very happy purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: You don't need to pay for assembly. This bike is awesome. I live in a tiny studio apartment in the city. I ride this bike about 10 miles each 3x a week, around town, and for fun. Its amazing for small storage. The black is nice of a color and the seat isn't as bad as everyone makes it seem. If you're going to be riding daily, I recommend the special seat, basket, and /or bungee cords for your back rack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: which I was guided to after this purchase is light years better, but is also more expensive
customer_reviews.text: Ride feel and geometry are as per the price point. It has 7 gears but all of them are for the low-gear range. Can't go too fast in this. The Brompton, which I was guided to after this purchase is light years better, but is also more expensive. I am retrofitting the sprockets on this product for some better gear ratios.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it but the folding lock broke!
customer_reviews.text: Well. I’ve ridden this bike 3 times and folded it up 3 times. The bolt that controls the folding lock stripped out - you can see it on the end of the bolt in the attached photo. I can still fold it but I have to carry this part around with me and hope I don’t lose it 😑
customer_reviews.author: Mountainsandstuff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get into my car
customer_reviews.text: I love to ride but it's dangerous around my neighborhood with cars. This bike is perfect to fit into my car. Now I go on rail trails for miles. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: JOANNE  BIRD

customer_reviews.title: The bike is great and easy to ride
customer_reviews.text: The bike is great and easy to ride. The only issue with the ride is the narrow hard seat. Like many people, I replaced it with a wider seat which makes a huge difference. I don't like that there is no way to hold the bike closed to load it in its bag or in the car. I also found that the first time I used the bag, the bike busted a hole in the bottom. This could be a great folding bike but needs some improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Cannot take on train.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a bike you can take on a train. Folded up it is still way to large. If you are just riding the bike and parking it I would recommend another one that is not folding. Folding it is just obnoxious, and takes so much extra time. Mine also didn’t come with a pedal, so it is basically useless right now.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.  Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bike. Just finished my inaugurate ride and found the bike comfortable and compact. It will certainly fulfill the need for my fitness and local transportation. I'll update after a month of usage but it appears to be very durabable. I am a 5'4" short legged big girl and the bike is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: EvieNB

customer_reviews.title: Rides well and folds compactly.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these Loops I have owned, and I believe the quality has improved. It rides well, comes almost fully assembled in the box, and easy to unfold. Easy to fold and put in the back of my small Sonoma pickup and take on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and easy-to-use bike
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike! I get many compliments from strangers about the look of it, as it looks both vintage and stylish. It has all the needed feature a modern bike has. The only thing I wish i had that the height of the handlebars was adjustable. I have a peculiar way of riding bikes, so I feel that if handlebar was higher, my posture would be straighter. Otherwise it's an absolute delight to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and solid bike
customer_reviews.text: Overall it was super easy to put together; everything was already set up, including wheels and brakes. You just need to inflate the tires and connect the clip in the middle and off you go. Very nice to ride; it is quite heavy but fits in the trunk no problem, easy to stow away and there is also a bag for the bike when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: CFTop Contributor: Star Trek

customer_reviews.title: Best Affordable Folding Bike
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Item arrived with flat tires - just needed air. Needed to readjust steering to wheels. Pros: Lightweight. Can easily carry up stairs or take a few mins to fold and bring on elevator. Comes with a carrying case but if you don't want to always use that purchase bungee cord or cable bike lock. Rides pretty well - needed to oil the gear chain but thats usual bike work. I'm using the bike to bike >1mile to and from work and occasional bike rides on trails. For the price, you definitely get a solid folding bike. Works great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Flash

customer_reviews.title: Amazon did it again!! & Nice people too!!
customer_reviews.text: This Review is after having the Schwinn Loop for several years &it is a follow up Review....!! This bike I have traveled here there & everywhere Taken on Bus Racks & Slightly modified.....!! I bought it here on Amazon in 2015.....I do my own Maintenance & also pick up Recycle cans & bottles on the road for physical health as much as the money involved.....Goto Food Banks along w/ the Trailer....This bike introduced me to the world of something other than conventional Mountain Bikes always leaning forward uncomfortably.....!! I'm thinking about installing a Bafang Mid Drive on this.....!! It certainly has earned a spot in my life as my sole source of Transportation....OH it's Aluminum try a magnet.....!! Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: todaniels71

customer_reviews.title: Great value and durable bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for wife for out Yosemite trip. The shifter come unadjusted, it won’t go to lowest chain(biggest). I have to adjust myself (as 20yrs of MTBer) which is easy for me but not as easy if u don’t know what r u doing. Good value and good bike for relax rides.
customer_reviews.author: DL_AMG

customer_reviews.title: Sadly sending back.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the way this bike looked being that it was a step through and I have mobility issues. However the pedals were almost impossible to pedal as if the pedal shafts were too long and the placement of pedals felt too far back. I REALLY WANTED TO LIKE THIS BIKE but it just didn’t work for me. Need a step through that low with normal pedal placement.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I like it overall. It is very useful and I like that I can easily get in and out of it because of the shape. I just wish that the rear carry rack is removable, so the total weight of the bike will somehow lessen especially since I don't really use the rack.
customer_reviews.author: kitkat

customer_reviews.title: Handle bar is not straight and there is no way to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for occasional fun ride. However the bike handle bar and front wheel is not perpendicular. What is worse is there is no way to adjust unlike other bikes duo to its foldable design. I thought I could get used to it overtime but I couldn’t. I get upset every time riding the bike. Now I want to return the bike but it is no longer an option on amazon site. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: xiangdong luo

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: used it once a week for an entire year to travel 30 minutes down a river trail to a night class, was easy to patch up the tire as well when it got punctured once but a broken glass piece. Slow speed but that is to be expected with the wheel size. 7 gears is useful when you're going up hill.
customer_reviews.author: courtney

customer_reviews.title: Fun Bike
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes this bike very much. The design is pretty cool. The only complaint is compared to a Dahon, this bike isn't that easy to store away. It's bulky even after folded up and it's a struggle getting this bike into a bag. A solution would be to strap secure the bike after folding it so it becomes easier to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike but check every part of it before using.
customer_reviews.text: I admit this bike is nice. My daughter loves it but it arrived with the big gear where the pedals are attached (Don’t know what it’s called) warped/bent. The chain won’t stay on it so the bike is usable . I don’t know if was shipped that way from the manufacturer or it was damaged during shipment. I’m returning it.
customer_reviews.author: GERARDO C RIVERO

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ride around Las Vegas!!! I purchase the Disconano Waterproof Multi Function Excursion Cycling Bicycle Bike Rear Seat Trunk Bag Carrying Luggage Package Rack Pannier with Rainproof Cover (Black) for the back rack and I am ready to go shopping or just riding without missing my Honda Touring.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie R.

customer_reviews.title: Great little bike
customer_reviews.text: Cute little folding bike. Very sturdy. I like that it has fenders and a back rack. Rides nice. You can add a mesh basket to the front. Had to take one star off because it is not easy to fold but other than that it’s a great little bike.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bike! I'm buying a second for me! this one was for my lady :)
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike! I'm 6'2 227lbs and I had no issue with this bike. The seat could even go higher! Its also easy to fold up and put back together. I'll never buy a normal bike again. I like going places and I hate bike racks screwing up my car so if your the same way try this one out. Don't buy those $700 models...what a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: AndyHouston

customer_reviews.title: All around mediocre and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Sprocket is warped so 1st and 7th speed settings do not work. The chain keeps slipping no matter how much I adjust it. The latches for the foldable joints are also not stable.
customer_reviews.author: freefood

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get a five, but it's a great ride!!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it came all ready. Of course I checked everything. The gears though were not engaging all the way. I mean the chain would either skip a level or not get to the last gear. So I had to read the manual and follow the instructions which not everyone can do. I just happen to be so hands on. I also bought folding pedals and changed the seat to a memory form model. The seat was killing my you know what...Otherwise I am happy to be able to ride along my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Dugavu

customer_reviews.title: Like this bike, but one arrived with a hole in one of the inter tubes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. Easy to assemble. Rides great. But as noted, one did arrive with a hole in a tube. Easier to order another than return the entire bike.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This makes it a good exercise vehicle
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to do as a folding bike. Takes more effort to pedal due to smaller wheels. This makes it a good exercise vehicle, but it is not designed for long rides.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H

customer_reviews.title: Heavy & Clunky but OK
customer_reviews.text: This bike is not as elegant or lightweight as expected. The frame lock is hard to operate, I had to have it adjusted at a bike shop, and overall it is fairly heavy, folding/unfolding and locking the frame is a nightmare, in the folded state the bike does not fit in the trunk of my sedan so I have to put it on the backseat to transport it. Only one pedal folds in. As far as riding it, it seems to ride fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from "Schwinn" - Returned It Same Day
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the quality. Rear wheel and gears were rough and wobbly. One pedal was not the fold up type. Contacted manufacturer and was told folding pedal was on back order. Quality was quite poor. Returned bike and purchased a EuroMini. Via for the same price (see my review). Superior engineering and design - WAY better quality. - and WAY less weight. Forget the Schwinn Loop. - get a EuroMini Via.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Small but Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how this smaller bike would serve a full-grown woman but it turns out.. very well. I love the size & flexibility. I can easily carry in the backseat of my tiny car. You'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I felt like I had to pedal a lot more for less ...
customer_reviews.text: Well built but I prefer a wider gear range. I felt like I had to pedal a lot more for less distance. I prefer to go back to using my 56cm 28in 700cc bike. I am 5'8" 165lbs and I felt like my pedaling was kind of cramped when I would try to pick up pace. If I was to calmly cruise, it was fine. So consider what you are comparing to and the gear ratio change. 20 inch wheels compared to 28 inch is quite different. I thought I would be able to deal with it but I was wrong. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: Devin L.

customer_reviews.title: Its a cheap bike
customer_reviews.text: Taking it out of the box and assembling was easy. The back brakes do not hold well , seat is hard as a rock, and there is a little uncomfortable horizontal play in handle bar stem. Price of bike is overpriced for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Karl D.

customer_reviews.title: I love the low step through
customer_reviews.text: I love the low step through. It is still a little stiff when I fold the bike in half but is getting easier. I am 67 and I would recommend this bike to any senior who wishes to exercise without pounding their joints. I already have a friend who bought one after seeing my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, quality, but out of the box the rear tire rubbed horribly on the fender. Took it to a bike shop near our RV park and Mike worked some magic! He had to totally readjust the rear wheel position on the frame and while we were there, adjusted the derailleur and brakes. He only charged $15, a great price for the work. I’d still recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: If you have a longer daily commute this would probably be better but if you just need something for a short ...
customer_reviews.text: Way too heavy than I expected. I wanted to bring with me on a commuter train without being too heavy. This has to be at least 30lbs. I returned and got the Retrospec which is $100 more but 10lbs lighter and easier to fold up. If you have a longer daily commute this would probably be better but if you just need something for a short bike ride get something lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Smith

customer_reviews.title: It might work for you
customer_reviews.text: The seat is very uncomfortable. I went on a 6 mile ride and my behind hurt so bad. It's not as easy to fold and unfold. There's a noise coming from the back of the bike when I ride. I may just give this to my eleven year old daughter.
customer_reviews.author: MoneySpender

customer_reviews.title: Video and review!
customer_reviews.text: I planed one trip for long time! I love Schwinn bikes. I started one project to travel with one folding bike. I bought one Schwinn Golding and happened this problem. Crown wraped, like video. The Schwinn owner’s manual dont have part number, 26 is seat and seat back but on boton have other piece like number 26 and their dont is seat or seat back! Im in Italy with american Schwinn bike and big problem. I start to ride today and jyst today i saw this factory problem. How can you help me please?
customer_reviews.author: jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just got the bike. Very well packaged and bike looks nice. Went for a ride and all is well. Taking it to a bike shop tomorrow to have them ck it out adjust brakes and shifter a bit. I have been cycling for many years road and single track and you always take a new bike in for fine tuning or if exp do it yourself. I have a nice broken in brooks b17 saddle that will replace seat. Been a couple of weeks and very happy with it after approx 50 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Dudley Eppes

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BIKE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is so beautiful. It's very easy to 'assemble' (basically unfolding it out of the box and tightening it up). I didn't buy it because it folds up. I bought is because it is very streamlined and perfect for city riding and just tooling around the neighborhood. If you want to fold it up (and unfold it) everyday (as opposed to occasionally) you might be better off with a more expensive, lighter, bike but if you want a beautifully designed, super cool bike, this is the bike for you. I'm a 50 year old woman who rides this in both Boston and Cape Cod and I couldn't be happier with this bike!
customer_reviews.author: Zoey Hughes

customer_reviews.title: unfold & go!
customer_reviews.text: Took a little bit of practice to unfold & refold putting it away. BUT, I love this bicycle! Fits into my truck just fine. Easy to unfold & go biking. 7 speeds is really not needed but, it was the lowest speeds, I could get a good bike. Definitely worth every penny, great buy for the money spent. Always telling everybody I meet while out biking, about it.
customer_reviews.author: Otto Molmen

customer_reviews.title: Quite a nice bike.
customer_reviews.text: The only issues are; it's not really easy to fold and the handle bars didn't line up with the front tire when I assembled it. Although it's an easy fix but, not for the price I paid for it. It should be completely ready to ride out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Verez

customer_reviews.title: Good for recreation but not daily commute.
customer_reviews.text: Constant internal clunking sound from that tube where pedals are (bottom bracket) drives me crazy. Tires are cheap nylon, under geared, seat is cheap. Frame is good, everything else will fall apart. My commute is 3 miles round trip.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

product_meta.title: Schwinn Loop Adult Folding Bike, 20-inch Wheels, Rear Carry Rack, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackFounded in 1895, Schwinn is an American icon, building some of the best known and best loved bicycles of all time. From its very beginning in Chicago, Illinois, the Schwinn mission has been to develop bicycles that allow people to experience the confidence and freedom that comes from riding a bike. Discover the convenience and utility of the Schwinn Loop Adult Folding Bicycle. In just a few easy steps, this brilliant device folds out to a bike that's big enough to accommodate a six foot rider. Great for camping or RV ing, this durable steel bike packs up so small that no bike rack is required. The folded size is 29.5 inches by 29 inches by 19 inches. Tackle small hills and cut through brisk winds easily, thanks to a seven speed Shimano RevoShift Twist Shifter and Shimano Tourney rear derailleur. The rear carry rack and an included nylon carry bag keeps the bike protected and concealed. Perfect for commuting, this bike features a kickstand and durable steel hinges. This bike ships ready to be assembled and weighs approximately 33 pounds. The wheels measure 20 inches.
